Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; exterior, white slip: two friezes separated by band; above, sphinx (underbelly with added red and two legs remaining) to left; spiked rosette as filling ornament and possible rosette at far right; below, goat (back and horn remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd joins London UCL 353. Williams (2006a, 128) notes that Chian dinos sherds are often mistaken for oinochoai because of the lack of glaze on the interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0015) (phase 2)
